channel.title: Firefox private browsing
channel.description:
As you all probably know you can go into private mode on firefox and it wont remember anything you input while in this mode. Useful if you have a shared computer and you don't want people knowing you masturbate to girls pooping into each others mouths.
Problem I have is that when I come out of private mode all my logins are reset, so I have to type my username and password again for all sites I've been to (even though I logged in to them when I wasn't in private mode). This only started happening after updating firefox and it's really starting to get on my nerves. Is this a bug or is it supposed to be like that, and if so how do I stop it happening?
ty

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

c|p:

especially since chrome is still improving.

Firefox is still improving as well though. I still frequently try chrome, and test my web pages in it, but firefox is all I use for day-to-day browsing. I can’t wait until it is stable enough to use on android either.

Read full topic

i still miss a few addons though…

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:20, topic:340486”]chrome was tough for me to get used to, but honestly i feel its a lot better than firefox if you spend some time with it.

as far as live bookmarks go: RSS Subscription Extension (by Google) + Google Reader.
as far as the adblock problem goes: it’s because of the way chrome renders pages. deal with it, you wont care about it eventually.

chrome is still pretty young, but it has gotten a lot better (and is still in active development). honestly the trade off of chrome not being a resource-sucking whore like firefox for a few “well-polished” addons and features is worth it, especially since chrome is still improving.[/quote]
Speed wise I’m not bothered, I don’t do anything that intensive on my computer. I tried chrome when it first came out and was impressed, but it lacked a few things I’ve come to expect in a browser. Trying it again a few days ago showed me it has improved but still lacks one or two things I need.

I’ve sorted my firefox problem out now, I guess it was the Tor addon I had that was doing it. So now I’m back to firefox.

I don’t believe there’s a right or wrong browser to have, it’s different per person. (Okay anything apart from internet explorer is fine). Firefox works for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Davidude:

(raged)

chrome was tough for me to get used to, but honestly i feel its a lot better than firefox if you spend some time with it.

as far as live bookmarks go: RSS Subscription Extension (by Google) + Google Reader.
as far as the adblock problem goes: it’s because of the way chrome renders pages. deal with it, you wont care about it eventually.

chrome is still pretty young, but it has gotten a lot better (and is still in active development). honestly the trade off of chrome not being a resource-sucking whore like firefox for a few “well-polished” addons and features is worth it, especially since chrome is still improving.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Right chrome is just god damn fucked up. Not being able to have the live bookmarks is getting on my tits, websites are fucked up because the adblock just removes the ad and doesn’t fix any of the page.

Also pisses me off that when an image doesn’t load it loads a little broken image picture, in Firefox it just doesn’t load it to save space…
::

My friend who creams over mozilla said if I do a clean install of firefox the private browsing shouldn’t delete my logins again so I’m now going to try this as chrome seems to be a pile of crap

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:12, topic:340486”][quote author=Natey link=topic=436856.msg3209915#msg3209915 date=1274141332]
Chrome = personal show for people at google.
[/quote]

Only if you’re a fucktard who agree’d to send usage data/statistics to google.

Chrome is epic, i can just ctrl+shift+n and i’m browsing without any trace of me doing so.[/quote]
And I can hit ctrl+shift+p and do the same thing

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Okay I just got chrome, it’s nice but my main problems with it are:

  • The adblock leaves holes in some pages where firefox would get rid of the gaps.
  • The BBC news live bookmark is gone

I’m sure I can probably get the bbc news live bookmark back but I’m not sure how, anybody know how to?

item.title: Firefox private browsing
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:7, topic:340486”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=436856.msg3209874#msg3209874 date=1274138908]
Go to the firefox preferences window, then click the security tab, then ensure “remember passwords for sites” is selected.
[/quote]
Got that selected.

On the subject of chrome does it have functioning adblock now?[/quote]not that i know of, but its incognito mode (private mode) is perfectly functional, also, on either you can just browse on regular browser and then just delete everything from past hour or so

As you all probably know you can go into private mode on firefox and it wont remember anything you input while in this mode. Useful if you have a shared computer and you don’t want people knowing you masturbate to girls pooping into each others mouths.
